article_title: Is It Immoral And Stupid For States To Refuse Obamacare's Medicaid Expansion?

article_metadata.description: Former Health and Human Services Secretary and former Kansas governor Kathleen Sebelius made news by calling the decisions of Kansas and Missouri to turn down the Medicaid expansion contained in the Affordable Care Act “morally repugnant and economically stupid.” In case you are interested, But, there are very real tradeoffs involved with states’ decisions to expand Medicaid. Moreover, if it is a moral imperative for states to provide Medicaid to able-bodied, working-age, childless adults under the ACA, one would think that it would have been a moral imperative before the ACA as well—regardless of who was footing the bill. Yet, only one state and D.C. expanded Medicaid to this population prior to the ACA.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
